assessment, hospital diet types, enteral feeds, and
supplemental parenteral nutrition

HOSPITAL DIET TYPES
STANDARD
regular, full fluid, clear fluid
THERAPEUTIC
heart healthy, diabetic, renal (predia
lysis, hemodialysis, peritoneal dialysis), sodium restricted
(2 g Na, 4 g Na), fiber restricted, high protein/calorie
SPECIAL
diets for cultural/religious modifications, dis
ease specific requirements (e.g. gluten free), various
nutrient specific therapeutic modifications (e.g. high
K+, purine restricted), neutropenic, post gastrectomy

ADVANTAGES
maintains gut integrity and immu
nologically favorable compared to total parenteral
nutrition
CONTRAINDICATIONS
hemodynamically unstable,
severe ileus, bowel obstruction, UGI bleed, distal
anastomosis, NG output >1 L/24 h, uncontrollable
nausea, vomiting and/or diarrhea, short gut, radiation
enteritis
